intro: Chilocarpus beccarianus, commonly known as the Beccari's chilocarpus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in the Philippines and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. It typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
